properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 8:09PM MST until February 8 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW ALONG WITH EXTREME WINDCHILLS
POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF INTERSTATE 80
WITH HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW LATER IN THE WEEK...

* WHAT...Very Heavy mountain snow. Total snow accumulations of 1
to 3 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...The Sierra Madre and Snowy Ranges across southern
Carbon and Albany counties.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Friday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Outdoor
enthusiasts and those with recreation interests in the
mountains should consider delaying outdoor activities late
this week.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitter cold wind chills as low as 40 below
zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
